Topic.Title: How to put html in quest game?

Posts.EditableText: I have tried and tried to convert quest files over using squiffy and python and pip and etc. How??? Is their a video tutorial or and step by step (not the documentation for squiffy) page. I got more confused trying to go to 101 different pages just to upload a text game. Please is there a easier way??
Posts.HTML: I have tried and tried to convert quest files over using squiffy and python and pip and etc. How??? Is their a video tutorial or and step by step (not the documentation for squiffy) page. I got more confused trying to go to 101 different pages just to upload a text game. Please is there a easier way??

Posts.EditableText: Quest and Squiffy are unrelated. What are you trying to do exactly?
Posts.HTML: Quest and Squiffy are unrelated. What are you trying to do exactly?

Posts.EditableText: I just want to make it so I can upload my game, I have sounds so I turn it into a zip file then tried to upload but it says can't read a html file in zip. How do I turn my quest game with sounds into html file?
Posts.HTML: I just want to make it so I can upload my game, I have sounds so I turn it into a zip file then tried to upload but it says can't read a html file in zip. How do I turn my quest game with sounds into html file?

Posts.EditableText:
If you want to upload a Quest game to the site, follow the instructions on the Submit page.

Squiffy is nothing to do with this, you didn't build your game using Squiffy.
Posts.HTML:
If you want to upload a Quest game to the site, follow the instructions on the Submit page.

Squiffy is nothing to do with this, you didn't build your game using Squiffy.

Posts.EditableText: The sounds should be included in the .quest file when you choose to publish the game within the (I'm assuming) desktop tool. The sounds should be in the same folder as the .aslx file and will be included automatically. You upload the published .quest file.
Posts.HTML: The sounds should be included in the .quest file when you choose to publish the game within the (I'm assuming) desktop tool. The sounds should be in the same folder as the .aslx file and will be included automatically. You upload the published .quest file.

Posts.EditableText: Whoops my bad im slow thought the sound files saved separate thank you.
Posts.HTML: Whoops my bad im slow thought the sound files saved separate thank you.
